unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **smart meter rollout gains momentum across india**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment initiative is gathering pace, with several states reporting significant progress. Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) announced on 26/10/2023 that over 5 lakh smart meters have been installed across the state, reducing aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: new delhi – the nationwide smart meter deployment initiative is gathering pace, with several states reporting significant progress. uttar pradesh power corporation limited (U P P C L) announced on twenty sixth october two thousand and twenty three that over five lakh smart meters have been installed across the state, reducing aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: Similarly, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) is aiming for complete smart meter coverage in Pune by Q2 2024, starting with a pilot project in Aundh at 10:00 hrs on 10/11/2023. These meters provide real-time data on electricity consumption, enabling consumers to manage their usage more effectively. Experts from IIT Kanpur are assisting in data analytics, aiming to predict demand and improve grid stability.
normalised: similarly, maharashtra state electricity distribution co. ltd. (M S E D C L) is aiming for complete smart meter coverage in pune by Q two two thousand and twenty four, starting with a pilot project in aundh at ten zero zero hours on tenth november two thousand and twenty three. these meters provide real-time data on electricity consumption, enabling consumers to manage their usage more effectively. experts from I I T kanpur are assisting in data analytics, aiming to predict demand and improve grid stability.

unnormalised: The initiative is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) launched by the Ministry of Power, with an outlay of Rs. 3.03 lakh crore. The scheme targets the installation of 25 crore smart meters by December 2025, contributing to a more efficient and reliable power distribution network across Bharat. The government expects a nationwide savings of approximately Rs. 10,000 crore per annum due to reduced power theft and improved billing accuracy after the implementation deadline.
normalised: the initiative is part of the revamped distribution sector scheme (R D S S) launched by the ministry of power, with an outlay of rupees three point zero three lakh crore. the scheme targets the installation of twenty five crore smart meters by december two thousand and twenty five, contributing to a more efficient and reliable power distribution network across bharat. the government expects a nationwide savings of approximately rupees ten thousand crore per annum due to reduced power theft and improved billing accuracy after the implementation deadline.
